Union of the koros I request protocol to
esort his
Excellency EXC on behalf of the assembly
I welcome his
Excellency Mr azali asumani President of
the Union of the koros and I invite him
to take the
floor president of the general assembly
Secretary
General of the United
Nations your majesties highnesses
excellencies heads of governments
distinguished representatives of
countries and instit
intitutions it is a real pleasure for me
to address you here today and I would
like to first thank the American
authorities we thank you uh very warmly
for the warm welcome that uh we see
every time we are here in New York in
order to participate in this great
annual Gathering of the international
Community next I would like to express
my very warm congratulations to his
Excellency Mr Dennis Francis
congratulate him on being brilliantly
elected to preside over the 78th session
of regular session of the general
assembly of the United
Nations and I'm all the more happy to do
so since uh this is a distinguished
representative of an island developing
State my country is one as well and we
now have such a person assuming a high
office there's no doubt uh your
Excellency that your professional
qualities and your
experience together with a particular
sensitivity you have when it comes to
development issues which is uh um a
characteristic of uh an person coming
from an iseland will be a token of
success of this current session I would
like to also use this opportunity to
pain a much deserved tribute to your
predecessor his
Excellency Mr chabak
korosi congratulate him on the
effectiveness with which he has
discharged his high Duty on behalf of us
all and finally I would like to on
behalf of my country and the African
Union express all of my thanks to his
Excellency Mr Antonio gutterz Secretary
General of the United Nations we thank
him for his constant
engagement and the engagement of all of
his teams in this service of our common
Institution for the benefit of one and
all distinguished delegates as a
chairperson of the African Union I would
like to today in front of this August
assembly Express the voice of all of the
African States it continues believing in
Fair and more effective multilateralism
because it is more inclusive and
therefore can help bring about long for
deep changes that we all want want wish
for because we want a better life for
the continent and the out the entire
world and this will be realized we are
convinced in an in-depth reform of the
United Nations system
Africa
where
3.8 billion people will live by the end
of this Century intends to play a
crucial role in attaining the stgs and
therefore has the right to
participate in global decision making
bodies and to inter Alia be on the
security Council as a permanent
member and thus realize its rights in
line with the Asen
ensus it is a question of equity um this
reform of the United Nations at Africa
has been asking for loudly and clearly
but it's also a question of
Effectiveness because it becomes a
matter of legitimacy and therefore of
the effectiveness of
multilateralism I would like to
furthermore use this opportunity so as
to reiterate on behalf of Africa our
thanks very sincere thanks to the
members of the G20 who have just
integrated the African Union which it is
my honor to chair in this year 2023
within their group and this diplomatic
victory for Africa but also for the
G20 through um India where this historic
decision was enacted gives us hope
especially at the time where a Synergy
of actions is needed in order to get our
countries out of the socioeconomic stale
made distinguished delegates ladies and
gentlemen the theme of this 78th General
Assembly rebuilding trust and reigniting
Global solidarity
accelerating
action um of the 2030 agenda and its
sustainable development goals towards
peace
prosperity progress and sustainability
for all this theme is very Timely the
African continent is facing numerous
challenges and there is a danger that
these challenges can compromise its
future and I think the trust and the
solidarity which has pride of place this
year will provide us with the solutions
which are adequate for our concerns we
are dealing with a challenge of food
security which is becoming wider and
wider spread in the continent this
desite the fact that we have immense
arable lands on the continent despite
the fact that we have qualified and
competent labor a plenty despite this
food insecurity continues affecting
millions of
people climate change and uh the
numerous conflicts on the continent
compound this
situation as does the Russian Ukrainian
War which brought brought in its
wake the disruption of supplies of grain
and
fertilizer and also brought in its wake
an unprecedented inflation you will
agree with me that it's inconceivable
that with all of these arable lands the
continent remains a major importer of
agricultural goods and this contributes
towards us creating a sizable shortfall
in its trade balance therefore at the
time when we're talking about solidarity
it is time for all Partnerships amongst
African governments development bodies
private sector both foreign and domestic
be strengthened so as to rise to this
Challenge and resolve it effectively and
in a lasting fashion it is also High
time for our partners to support us in
implementing far-reaching reforms such
as for example the transfer of expertise
and technology so as to help those
countries which are severely affected
help us promote agricultural development
and more specifically produce and uh
transform our Goods
locally thus adding value to them and uh
helping us combat shortages and famine
we also need to strengthen our fight
against climate change because and we
live through um through it all of us our
planet um is constantly dealing with
various climate events and most
specifically Cyclones floods um
earthquakes Rising Waters droughts and
the list is far from exhaustive
frequent uh disasters of course have
devastating effects on our economies on
our social infrastructure on our
Agriculture and our people in particular
the most vulnerable and brings in its
way Public Health crisis which further
um underscore the vulnerability of the
continent I would like to use this
opportunity to renew our deep
condolences and also our solidarity to
our brothers in the Kingdom of Morocco
and in Libya their country have just
suffer suffered enormous human losses
and material damages in the wake of such
natural disasters I'm also thinking of
the many countries in Europe and Asia in
America who are hard hit by the
devastating consequences of forest fires
of floods and
storms uh above and beyond the numerous
human losses the damages uh resulting
from these
catastrophes require the uh cost of
rebuilding and Recovery which is not
always something that our countries can
sustain are therefore call on on the
International Community to promote
communal approaches better structured
and adapted and especially within the
framework of funding to um meet these
disasters on a large scale so that we
can provide our people with the support
that they need and help them recover and
especially I call for the effective
implementation of the recommendations
having to do with the protection and
safeguarding of the environment for the
implement of the commitments undertaken
in the area of adaptation and
mitigation the lowering of the level of
the greenhouse effects and the funding
pledged to combat climate change have to
in uh in fact be translated in specific
actions if we want to live in future in
a world which is safer and more
prosperous I call therefore for support
to the Moroni declaration issued uh last
June on Blue economy and the Nairobi
declaration uh of last September and
this to make sure that the countries can
defend in with one one voice their
common interests and uh helps develop
sustainably in particular to do this
during the upcoming cop 28 in Dubai uh
to wish to which we would like to wish
every success and finally I would like
to launch an appeal to strengthen the
capacities of un
habitat I'm asking for more substantial
support in the implementation of the new
Ur Urban agenda so that this agenda can
better support our African cities which
which are full of potential but which
have become very vulnerable to climate
change distinguished delegates ladies
and
gentlemen I um cannot talk about the
challenges of the African continent
without talking about the political and
security situation and complex and
worrying situation on our continent and
in particular in the Sahel as we all
know the Sahel this region of Africa
which since 2010 has been seriously
affected by insecurity and terrorism
there are terrorist groups who have
intensify their
attacks against Security Forces but also
against civilians and civilian
infrastructure it is urgent therefore
that the International Community should
strengthen its efforts aimed at
accompanying us in our attempts to
stabilize this region knowing that the
global planetary Village in which we all
live that on this planet crisis are very
easily imported and therefore have
consequences on economies and the
investment within and between countries
of course first and foremost it's up to
the Africans um to implement the
economic and social devel development
plans within the framework of agenda
2063 so as to better uh combat poverty
and youth
unemployment but especially to make sure
that the young people do not become
hostages to all kinds of extremism
however it is also the duty of the
International Community to support
Africa in this action because our um

stand the chance of being
effective in addition to terrorism
unfortunately Africa is also facing the
Resurgence of anti-constitutional
changes they compromise and undermine
democracy peace security stability and
our socioeconomic
development and it is in this regard
that the African Union has undertaken
sanctions against those who commit Acts
such acts and demands rapid return to
constitutional order in the countryes
concerned and I would like to hear
recall solemnly that a political life
worthy of its name is not possible
without respecting electoral Tim tables
and legitimate um institutional
mechanisms which underg a democratic
public life your excellencies ladies and
gentlemen distinguished
delegates Africa of course is under all

our regional integration to stop the

that our countries underwent in
particular inflation and logistical and

growth potential our daily life for our
people and the stability of our states
and it is in this regard that since 2021
we have been implementing the African
Continental free exchange area a major
Continental Common Market uh and this is
with a hope to give new impetus to
growth and African GDP having this tool
at our disposal it is our it is my task
to accelerate during the time that I'm
chair pres of the
Au uh for uh the continent and uh um
using this tool to create the needed
wealth to better handle our demogra
demographic growth this uh area will
contribute to the implementation of our
common uh ambition to move towards
industrializing the continent because
Africa has to stop being a simple
provider of raw
materials um whilst uh uh enabling us to

sectors to create jobs the uh Common
Market um area on the continent would
also to stimulate technology transfer
and promote foreign investment because
it will open for other continent
immediate access to a market of more

like to reiterate um our request for

community of Latin American and
Caribbean States celak even making it
institutional uh and put together a
joint AU SEL commission this partnership
will not only strengthen cooperations

help us to capitalize on the partnership
with our friends and brothers in the
north similarly to the rest of the world
African countries uh need more than ever
peace and security to be able to have
better living conditions peace and
development will also result through
resolving a political and territorial
Pro problems which have to do with the

of Nations it was these concern that
push pushed
us uh me and my African carders to go to
a meeting with President uh piny and

KF and Center St Petersburg respectively
we therefore stand ready to support any
and all other initiatives aimed at
ending this war which negatively impacts
our goals our goals to increase the

reiterate once again with a goal of
safeguarding peace and stability and on
behalf of the African Union that there
is a high need to come up with a just

Palestine a solution which would

the IL mayot and uh I recall that in

um disagreeable dispute and to do so in

like to underscore my determination and
determination of my government to honor
the institutions and the Democratic life
of the Camaros by organizing free
transparent and Democratic upcoming
presidential elections and go and
Governor's elections in 2024 I would
like to also recall that the union of
the Camaros managed to put an end to
this cycle of political instability
which used to be the characteristic of
our political life since Independence in
1975 and this was done thanks to the
policy of national reconciliation that I
have been conducting since 2000 this
policy of reconciliation supported by
the African Union the United Nations and
all of our partners have brought
stability to the country and it is our
duty to build on it and to sustain it
since 2002 in fact the date of the 26th
may have become a symbolic date of the
transfer of power in the Camaros because
it is on this date we have the um
transfer of power power at resulting
from free and transparent presidential
elections it is with this concern in
mind the concern to preserve peace and
stability and democracy in the union of
the Camaros that I am asking once again
for your support in your accompaniment
so that the upcoming presidential
elections and the election of Governors
planned for the month of December and
January next should be conducted under
good conditions to conclude let me say
that I am confident that on the 26th of
May
2024 we will once again celebrate the
political maturity of the people of the
Camaros and the inauguration ceremony of
the next president of the Union of the
Camaros will symbolize the deep
rootedness and the strength of our
democracy I thank
you on behalf of the general assembly I
would like the president of the Union of
the curos for the statement just made
